Player History
Drafted in 5th round, 97th overall pick, by Syracuse in 1951...
Injured on 6/4/1952 with a Pulled Hamstring Muscle, out for 1-2 weeks...
Injured on 8/19/1958 with a Bruised Heel, out for 1-2 weeks...
Drafted in 2nd round, 35th overall pick, by Boston (FBA) in 1967...
Had first career hit on 4/1/1970, off Bob Gleich (MAN)...
Hit first career homerun on 5/13/1970, off Ryan Grimaldo (DIA)...
Won Slick Fielder Award at Shortstop in 1970...
Hit 3 homeruns against Toledo, driving in 6 runs on 5/26/1972...
Won Slick Fielder Award at Shortstop in 1973...
Won World Championship with Boston (FBA) in 1977...
Signed as a free agent by Syracuse on 2/7/1979 to a 2-year deal worth $1,600,000 per year...
